articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: CORRECTED-Reports of attacks on U.S. military base in Iraq are false -two sources
articles.description: Reports of an attack on Iraq's Ain al-Asad air base which hosts U.S. forces in the western Anbar province are false, a security source inside the base and a local official at a nearby town said.
articles.content:
(Corrects 2nd paragraph to say “unconfirmed”) 
FALLUJA, Iraq, Jan 3 (Reuters) - Reports of an attack on Iraq’s Ain al-Asad air base which hosts U.S. forces in the western Anbar province are false, a security source inside the base and a local official at a n… [+219 chars]

articles.title: Violence in Sudan's West Darfur left 65 dead, peacekeepers say
articles.description: Violence in Sudan's West Darfur region over the past week has left at least 65 people dead and more than 50 injured, as well as displacing thousands, an international peacekeeping mission said on Friday.
articles.content:
KHARTOUM (Reuters) - Violence in Sudan’s West Darfur region over the past week has left at least 65 people dead and more than 50 injured, as well as displacing thousands, an international peacekeeping mission said on Friday.

articles.title: Killing of Iranian commander 'extreme provocation': Buttigieg
articles.description: Democratic presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg, a military veteran, on Friday said President Trump's authorization of the attack on Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani "must not be the beginning of another endless war."
articles.content:
Posted 
Democratic presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg, a military veteran, on Friday said President Trump's authorization of the attack on Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani "must not be the beginning of another endless war."
